title: Program for Improving Awareness of Effective Mathematics Teaching Methods Using PowerPoint

context.prior_knowledge: Basic PowerPoint proficiency and secondary-level mathematics teaching experience
context.additional_context: Program supporting corporate mathematics training instructors to recognize the effectiveness of PowerPoint-based teaching methods and develop concrete strategies for increasing learner engagement.

learning_goals: Learners can recognize functional limitations of PowerPoint (e.g., excessive text copying, rapid pacing) and explain at least three learner-friendly slide design criteria
The ability to design instructional materials using visual elements (e.g., diagrams, animations) appropriate for explaining mathematical concepts is assessed
An action plan is developed to improve existing PowerPoint utilization methods based on feedback grounded in mixed research methods (quantitative + qualitative)

resources: Digital Survey Tool for Feedback Collection

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
